thread.title: Tulane researcher delves into the teenaged brain
thread.title_full: Tulane researcher delves into the teenaged brain - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: Written by: Christie Walton
title: Tulane researcher delves into the teenaged brain
text:
NEW ORLEANS, LA (WVUE) - Generations of parents probably would have paid good money to understand what's going inside the teenaged brain.
Now, a Tulane University researcher is studying the adolescent brain as part of a $5.9 million dollar grant from the National Science Foundation.
Yu-Ping Wang is an associate professor of biomedical engineering.
He will work with researchers at the Mind Research Network to explore inner workings of the brain during the period of rapid development of youngsters between 9 and 14 years old.
The researchers want to get a better understanding of brain functions with the goal of being able to better diagnose mental illness and disorders earlier.
